results.title: Skittles
results.creator_credit: Daniel McCrimmon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daniel McCrimmon moved to Shepparton eight and a half years ago. He tells us of his time there, his friends, favorite places and his ambitions for the future.

results.title: Skippy the Bush Kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Max Varnel, Bob Austin, John McCallum, Lee Robinson and Norfolk International Pictures
results.brief_description: Features two episodes of the television series. “Double trouble” looks at a rival who is trying to take control of the Waratah National Park; “Chicken” is about Skippy being poisoned by a local farmer who holds a grudge against the head ranger.

results.title: Skippy the Bush Kangaroo
results.brief_description: Skippy the Bush Kangaroo is one of Australia’s most beloved TV series, which followed the adventures of a young boy and his kangaroo solving problems and kids from wells.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

results.title: Skippy and the 3 RRR's
results.brief_description: Shows how a first grade boy is taught reading, writing and arithmetic by a teacher who utilises the boy’s interests to help him to realise his own need for learning. He learns by experience that school is a fascinating place where he is made to feel part of the group and where he receives sympathetic understanding.

results.title: Skipping Girl
results.brief_description: The narrative centres on a young Melbourne woman trying to come to terms with sex and love in her own life - and everyone else’s. Witty interviews with whacky characters off the street spice the existential fictional narrative.

results.title: Skipping class
results.creator_credit: Maureen McCarthy, Chris Warner and Trout Films
results.brief_description: A dramatised re-enactment of cultural conflict and the parent, student, teacher triangle. Steve is a seventeen year old, born in Macedonia and living in Australia, who is not doing well at school. He is caught in between a father, who has high hopes for him, and a burnt out teacher, and in the end it is Steve who suffers most.

results.title: Skip bombing
results.brief_description: The term “skip bombing” is applied when the bomb is purposely bounced from the water and is aimed to make allowances for the distance travelled after hitting the water. Shows by diagrams the calculations needed to correctly use this method of attack. Also show examples of bombs of varying weights being dropped from various heights at various speeds from different types of aircraft. “It is considered that a slick of four bombs should be dropped to ensure that the ship will sink and the motto should be ‘Every skip a ship and damnation to Tojo’.”
results.description: The term “skip bombing” is applied when the bomb is purposely bounced from the water and is aimed to make allowances for the distance travelled after hitting the water. results.title: Skinsense
results.creator_credit: Peter Bence, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A general discussion on attaining and mantaining normal healthy skin. Includes haircare and shampoos, nailcare and general skincare, moisturisers, soaps, cosmetics and deodorants. The effects of sunshine on skin and protective behaviour are also covered.

results.title: Skinny skiing
results.creator_credit: Len Aitken, Bill Snyder and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: Presents a group of cross-country skiers talking about the sport, telling how it is a way of life for them rather than a pastime. Shows them skiing in various settings. Also depicts the correct way to build and occupy a snow cave, and contrasts equipment - skis circa 1900 versus today’s efficient, low-cost skinny skis. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.
